(:Paper {journal: Materials Research Bulletin,year: 2025,title: Efficient enhancement of piezo-catalytic activity of BaTiO3-based piezoelectric ceramics via phase boundary engineering,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.materresbull.2024.113188})

(:Paper {journal: Materials Research Bulletin,year: 2025,title: Efficient enhancement of piezo-catalytic activity of BaTiO3-based piezoelectric ceramics via phase boundary engineering,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.materresbull.2024.113188})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Weighed ingredients were added into alcohol, ball milled for 18 hours and dried in oven
- Materials were calcined in a muffle furnace at 1100°C for 4 hours, ball milled for 24 hours and dried again
- 10 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added to the powder with uniform mixing and pressed into a disc with a diameter of 10 mm and a thickness of 1 mm
- Target products were obtained by a debinding process in a muffle furnace at 650°C and a sintering process at 1350°C for 2 hours})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of the European Ceramic Society,year: 2025,title: Effect of MnO2 content on the growth and electric properties of <110>c-oriented 0.85(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-0.15BaTiO3 single crystals fabricated by solid-state crystal growth method,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jeurceramsoc.2024.117043})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of the European Ceramic Society,year: 2025,title: Effect of MnO2 content on the growth and electric properties of <110>c-oriented 0.85(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-0.15BaTiO3 single crystals fabricated by solid-state crystal growth method,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jeurceramsoc.2024.117043})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Weighed raw powders according to the chemical formula
- Ball-milled with zirconia balls and ethanol at 250 rpm for 16 h
- Dried at 80 °C
- Added 5 wt% polyvinyl butyral binder and passed through a 250 µm mesh
- Pressed mixed powder and SrTiO3 seed crystal into a disc compact at 200 MPa
- Heated at 700 °C for 2 h in air to remove the binder
- Heated at 1200 °C for 24 h in air for sintering
- Thermally etched polished samples at 1050 °C for 30 min
- Applied Ag paste to the {110}c faces and heated to 550 °C to form Ag electrodes})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Electroanalytical Chemistry,year: 2025,title: Low-temperature piezoelectric/ferroelectric coating layer driving lithium-ion rapid diffusion and structure stability of LiCoO2 cathode,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jelechem.2025.118929})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Electroanalytical Chemistry,year: 2025,title: Low-temperature piezoelectric/ferroelectric coating layer driving lithium-ion rapid diffusion and structure stability of LiCoO2 cathode,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jelechem.2025.118929})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Dissolve Ta2O5, CH3COOLi·2H2O, and C4H6O6 in ethanol
- Mix solution with commercial LiCoO2 powders and stir vigorously
- Evaporate and stir at 80 °C until sol formation
- Age sol at 120 °C for 10 h to obtain gel
- Anneal powder at 500 °C for 12 h and cool to room temperature
- Compact LTO powders into disk using polyvinyl butyral binder
- Sinter disk in air at 500 °C for 3 h})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Alloys and Compounds,year: 2025,title: Improving the piezoelectric response of Ba0.85Ca0.15Zr0.10Ti0.90O3 ferroelectric ceramics via the asymmetric-shape-induced flexoelectric effect,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jallcom.2025.178777})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Alloys and Compounds,year: 2025,title: Improving the piezoelectric response of Ba0.85Ca0.15Zr0.10Ti0.90O3 ferroelectric ceramics via the asymmetric-shape-induced flexoelectric effect,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jallcom.2025.178777})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Weigh raw materials according to stoichiometric ratio
- Mix and ball-mill with ethanol for 12 hours
- Dry mixture at 120 °C
- Calcinate powder at 1250 °C for 5 hours
- Ball-mill calcined powder again for 12 hours
- Press powder into desired shape using cold isostatic press at 30 MPa for 15 minutes
- Sinter at 1400-1500 °C for 4 hours})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Alloys and Compounds,year: 2025,title: Phase structure and electrical properties of ternary PSN-PMN-PT ceramics and their applications in ultrasonic transducers,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jallcom.2025.178686})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Alloys and Compounds,year: 2025,title: Phase structure and electrical properties of ternary PSN-PMN-PT ceramics and their applications in ultrasonic transducers,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jallcom.2025.178686})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Synthesize precursors MgNb2O6 at 1000 °C and ScNbO4 at 1150 °C
- Weigh MgNb2O6, ScNbO4, TiO2, and PbO in stoichiometric proportion with 2 mol% extra PbO
- Mix alcohol and oxide powders in 1:1 ratio by wet-milling for 24 h
- Calcinate combined powder at 800-850 °C for 2 h
- Mix calcined mixture again for 12 h
- Conglutinate powder with PVA solution and press into tablets under 8 MPa
- Burn off PVA at 550 °C for 2 h
- Cover ceramic tablets with same composition powder and sinter at 1200-1280 °C for 4 h
- Polish samples and coat with silver electrodes
- Pole samples at 130 °C for 15 min under 30 kV/cm electric field})

(:Paper {journal: Materials Today Communications,year: 2025,title: Influence of oxygen vacancies and electrical properties in Ba0.92Ca0.08Zr0.05Ti0.95O3 ceramics through the co-doping of La3 + and Tm3+ ions,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.mtcomm.2025.111645})

(:Paper {journal: Materials Today Communications,year: 2025,title: Influence of oxygen vacancies and electrical properties in Ba0.92Ca0.08Zr0.05Ti0.95O3 ceramics through the co-doping of La3 + and Tm3+ ions,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.mtcomm.2025.111645})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Raw precursors were added to an Erlenmeyer flask and ethanol was added to react for 3 h to obtain polymer solutions.
- Solutions were placed in the oven at 120 °C for 10 h.
- Calcined at 900 °C for 2 h in a muffle furnace to form precursor powders.
- Powders were mixed with 2 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as an organic binder (weight ratio of PVA and powders was 1:120).
- Formed into disks with a diameter of 20 mm under 20 MPa pressure with a retention time of 150 s.
- Disks were embedded in alumina and sintered at 1300 °C for 4 h in air using a heating rate of 5 °C/min.})

(:Paper {journal: Sensors and Actuators A: Physical,year: 2025,title: PIMNT piezocrystal ultrasonic scalpel transducer with enhanced electromechanical performances,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.sna.2024.116149})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Sliced PIMNT samples into 5x5x0.5 mm wafers
- Painted silver electrodes onto sample surfaces
- Fired at 750 °C for 30 min to form electrodes
- Poled with an electric field of 10 kV/cm at 140 °C for 15 min in silicone oil
- Slowly cooled to room temperature while electric field was halved})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Environmental Chemical Engineering,year: 2025,title: Piezoelectric polarization-induced photogenerated carriers transfer coupled with active electron transport Z-scheme heterojunction synergistic optimization of BiFeO3/CdS composite photocatalysts for hydrogen production,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jece.2024.115049})

(:Paper {journal: Journal of Environmental Chemical Engineering,year: 2025,title: Piezoelectric polarization-induced photogenerated carriers transfer coupled with active electron transport Z-scheme heterojunction synergistic optimization of BiFeO3/CdS composite photocatalysts for hydrogen production,isOpenAccess: false,doi: 10.1016/j.jece.2024.115049})
m:
(:Step {steps: - Dissolve Bi(NO3)3 and Fe(NO3)3·9H2O in deionized water to obtain 0.11 M bismuth nitrate and 0.1 M iron nitrate solutions.
- Add 3 mL of nitric acid (68%) to the bismuth nitrate solution under constant stirring until completely dissolved.
- Mix the two solutions and add 0.02 mol of triammonium citrate as the complexing agent, stir for 30 min.
- Obtain gel by continuous stirring at 90°C until water is completely evaporated.
- Calcinate the gel at 550°C for 2 h to obtain pure phase BFO powder particles.
- For CdS nanosheets: Add 10 mL of 0.3 M cadmium chloride solution to 50 mL of 0.1 M sodium citrate solution and stir at room temperature for 20 min.
- Add 3 mL of concentrated ammonia (28%) and 10 mL of 0.6 M thiourea solution sequentially.
- React the mixed solution in a water bath at 60°C for 2.5 h.
- Collect the precipitate by centrifugation, rinse with deionized water and anhydrous ethanol, and dry at 60°C to obtain CdS nanosheets.
- For BFO/CdS composites: Weigh 0.6 g of BFO into 60 mL of 0.1 M sodium citrate solution, add 1.38 mL of 0.3 M cadmium chloride solution (10 wt% of BFO), and stir at room temperature for 3 h.
- Add 3.6 mL of concentrated ammonia (28%) and 1.38 mL of 0.9 M thiourea solution slowly.
- React at 60°C in a water bath for 2.5 h.
- Collect the precipitate, rinse with deionized water and anhydrous ethanol, and dry at 60°C to obtain 10% CdS/BiFeO3 (BC10) samples.
- Adjust cadmium chloride and thiourea solution volumes to obtain 20% and 30% CdS/BiFeO3 composites (BC20 and BC30).})
